item.title: Why This Master Artist’s Technique Works So Well
item.description: I watched Samir Kosami’s technique and immediately knew I wanted that soft, polished, skin-like makeup on my face. This is my take on his effortless approach that looks elevated, natural, and especially beautiful on mature, hooded eyes.

media:content.media:title: Why This Master Artist’s Technique Works So Well
media:content.media:description: I watched Samir Kosami’s technique and immediately knew I wanted that soft, polished, skin-like makeup on my face. This is my take on his effortless approach that looks elevated, natural, and especially beautiful on mature, hooded eyes.

item.title: How To Create A Visible Black Smokey Eye On Hooded Eyes
item.description: If you’ve got hooded eyes, a black smokey eye can disappear the moment you relax your lid and suddenly look like plain eyeliner. In this tutorial, I’m showing you exactly how I map a new crease above the hood to double the visible lid space and keep the smokey effect bold and lifted. These small placement tweaks make all the difference, and once you see it, you’ll never do a hooded-eye smokey the same way again.

media:content.media:title: How To Create A Visible Black Smokey Eye On Hooded Eyes
media:content.media:description: If you’ve got hooded eyes, a black smokey eye can disappear the moment you relax your lid and suddenly look like plain eyeliner. In this tutorial, I’m showing you exactly how I map a new crease above the hood to double the visible lid space and keep the smokey effect bold and lifted. These small placement tweaks make all the difference, and once you see it, you’ll never do a hooded-eye smokey the same way again.
